Was thinking this morning about OF MICE & MEN and how I loved the ending where Lenny gets a pet rabbit and George makes enough $$ to buy a farm and they fish every day and live off the fat of the land. I never finished (too long!), but I'm pretty sure that's where it was going.

Finished THE THURSDAY MURDER CLUB by @richardosman and now @GillianRedfearn and I appear to be in a gentle, silent war about who gets to have it on their bookshelf. To be clear: the facts support the book going on HER shelf, but it is on mine because I'm conniving and selfish.
@Massawyrm ahahahahaha

More seriously, JUDAS AND THE BLACK MESSIAH and THE TRIAL OF THE CHICAGO 7 won my heart, and I hope they do well. Can't really express an opinion about the other major nominees -- I missed 'em. To bare the honest truth of my soul, I'm not really a big Oscar bait watcher.
Hoping THE INVISIBLE MAN and SYNCHRONIC will sweep Oscar tonight, if you have information to the contrary, keep it to yourself.
@DanPhillips0 Def.

Apparently you can click on a song and access Genius Suggestions, which does the same thing. So cool! https://t.co/OANsE7G1tC

Yeah, it's the iconic cornerstone of the entire MCU. It is to the Marvel franchise what A New Hope was to Star Wars. Impossible to imagine the rest without that first supernova of humor, action, and imagination. https://t.co/YLLJ1GOmOd

That's my operating assumption. As with Star Wars, in some ways it appears the Disney+ Marvel shows might be the new best way forward... the most satisfying for the fans. They offer bigger canvases on which to tell stories. https://t.co/wGVFuaosQs

Or one could follow Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, Bucky Barnes, Sam Wilson, Thor, etc. Tony & Steve might have the most satisfying character journeys, although Sam Wilson is right behind them now. Personally I think a Stark-fest could be a great way to re-experience the MCU.

One could watch the groundbreakers, the films that broadened what Marvel films could be.
IRON MAN
AVENGERS
BLACK PANTHER
SPIDER-MAN: INTO THE SPIDER VERSE
WANDAVISION
By now you've noticed I'm cheating by mixing in TV shows and stuff like Spiderverse, but go with me.

Or one could look at the films that tackle more serious themes. That's:
IRON MAN
CAPTAIN AMERICA: THE WINTER SOLDIER
AVENGERS: INFINITY WAR
AVENGERS: ENDGAME
FALCON AND THE WINTER SOLDIER
Plenty of wit in these films and serious stuff in the first list but the point stands.

Best then, to follow a narrower path. For example: one could follow the comedic strain, which probably looks like
IRON MAN
AVENGERS
GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY
ANT MAN
THOR: RAGNAROK.
That would make a good weekend film festival.

The creators have made earnests efforts to keep things fresh, but lets face it: out of 23 films, maybe 21 end with a big CGI fight in which the outcome is a foregone conclusion. That's fine! Taken individually. All together, it might actually damage one's affection for the series

There are a lot of lists going around: 8 ways of looking at Murakami, 12 ways of looking at Hitchcock. My own contribution might be four ways of watching the MCU. Begin from this position: There are currently 23 films in the MCU & all watched in close succession might wear. (1/?)

@Massawyrm I remember watching CLASS OF 1984 as a teenager and feeling it was really jolting and transgressive. No idea how it holds up, though. The Dirty-Harry-Substitute-Teacher genre is an interesting one, though. Remember the Tom Berringer vehicle, THE SUBSTITUTE?

If you listen to one song on your iPhone, Apple will automatically generate a kind of endless playlist of stuff on the same wavelength. Why doesn't it offer that feature in the Music app itself? You can make a Genius Playlist, but that isn't really quite the same.

You saw the #FalconAndWinterSoldierFinale this afternoon, now make it an Anthony Mackie double feature and check out SYNCHRONIC on @netflix. A brilliant, beautiful, knotty work of SF... reminds me of the charge I felt seeing MOON for the first time.

I’m not going to claim #FalconAndWinterSoldier is perfect in every way. But it was beautifully written and it had guts: it dared to take on some really difficult ideas about race and history, superheroes and symbols. Looked at as a movie, it’s one of the 6 - 7 best in the MCU.

There's even a name for it: "Marvel-Dead." And, hey, Conan Doyle brought back Holmes. It can be done (there are no absolutely concrete storytelling rules). Loki died, now he's got a TV show coming (and I'm looking forward to it). Mostly, tho, I prefer a bit more cruel-kind truth. https://t.co/I4ijFhXRbB

A terrible idea, of course. An ending gives the rest of a story its emotional power... and even in something as frothy and fun as a superhero tale, there's sort of a moral obligation to be honest about death as a final full-stop to a life. https://t.co/2zva5GMXEx

As a life-long Sherlock Holmes nut, I read every bit of this article, and now you need to too. Also, picking a favorite Holmes is obviously subjective, even though any other list would be objectively wrong. I know, it's a paradox!

@praddenkeefe @AlecMacGillis @AndersonsBkshp I am the proud owner of both books.
@colsonwhitehead @MissLiberty Holy shit, when can I have it???
And I felt too defeated to ask.

Old gent behind the counter stared at me like I asked him for a xylophone. “Young man, we haven’t been allowed to sell such a thing for sixty years. It IS the 21st century, you know. Maybe you can buy some pepper spray.” He didn’t say if they had a cane that shoots pepper spray.

Their answer: James & Sons. Traffic was mad so I jogged there with my suitcase, under a blazing blue sky. Got there dripping with sweat and panting for breath. “I was hoping *gasp* you could sell me *pant* one of your finest *haah haahhh* sword canes.”

I thought about what I had always wanted to do in London. I thought hard. Then it hit me: “I’d like to buy a sword cane.” I had always seen myself walking the streets of London with a sword cane.
The editor and her team fell into an intense conversation about where to get one.

I have a story about Smith & Sons, London’s greatest umbrella shop. I was in the UK for the release of Heart-Shaped Box. I had a few hours before I had to go to Heathrow for my flight home. My editor asked me what I was going to do with a whole afternoon in the Big Smoke. https://t.co/3GeTWhhoU1

@_wokewakandan There's no bigotry in my tweet -- it was a mile high view of the political predicament in which the GOP finds itself, which is lacking several of their traditional weapons to win elections.
Bigotry looks more like bills designed to make it hard for black people to vote.

Ah, geez. When I was a kid, I loved BAT OUT OF HELL. Steinman gave me a signed record of his solo album (which later formed the spine of Meatloaf's comeback record). His note read: "It's okay if you don't like it, I hear it burns very well." Self-effacing and witty. https://t.co/WS58Hawujn

The 1st issue of Hell & Gone, the #LockeandKey/#SandmanUniverse crossover, is in stores now. The @blumhouse adaptation of THE BLACK PHONE, co-written by @scottderrickson & @Massawyrm, directed by Scott, is on the way. Both have been lookin after me in the swag dept. https://t.co/7ikMgSyGjL

Hey, @GR_comics, did you ever share the original cover for "February" and the published cover? People could play spot-the-difference.

The 2nd amendment absolutism (an absolutism that ignores the part of the text about "well-regulated militias") isn't helping the GOP recover their virtue. Makes 'em look indifferent to a relentless drumbeat of American slaughter. Nothin pro-life about letting kids get splattered.

Without *any* moral purchase, it's hard to see how you argue for a right to legislate. I'd think any Republican reclamation project would have to begin there -- with a downright merciless house-cleaning to establish the rules of the road. It's goin the other way, tho, innit? https://t.co/J8NTnKYjoR

For me the big surprise of modern politics is how willingly the GOP surrendered their claim as the "values" party. After you went to the mattresses for the grab-em-by-the-pussy guy, a dude who incited insurrection from Michigan to the Capitol, you got no moral horse to ride.
@marktobindesign Survivor. It taught everyone that survival is a zero sum game (when, in fact, the whole history of the human race shows that survival and success is collaborative)

If you REALLY wanna be pissed off, get a lot of the crappe I'm listening to in high rotation. Hill House Radio, updated a couple times a week. Play loud.

https://t.co/GSoJKJeeKI
Not a comment on anything actually happening today, just a general thought.

"What's happening" could probably cover a whole bunch of non-outrage-y stuff but then (hahahaha) people would go elsewhere for their cup of piss off. The problem isn't software; it's wetware. We love to gather in a circle and chant "fight fight fight."

I read somewhere about how the "what's happening" tab is always about who Twitter is dunking on today; the whole point is to keep a nice simmer of outrage going so we'll keep refreshing our feed. Mmhm. Social media, man. It's a bummer.

Guys, I'm actually a sad last minute miss on this -- wound up with an unavoidable conflict. But do tune in to hear from a murderer's row of great writers about @mjkoryta's new anthology WHEN A STRANGER COMES TO TOWN. So pleased to have a story in there. https://t.co/R9QgWh7s90

The new #FalconAndTheWinterSoldier gets into heavy stuff: race, history, guilt, atonement, self-definition. The writing here is at an extraordinary level (although it doesn’t *all* work: the people who wanna help refugees are the big evil, WTF?). Can’t wait for the last chapter.

Someone at Graphic Policy made a cut-and-paste error at the opening of this fine review of Hell & Gone. No reason to be embarrassed — we’ve all done it. I hope they won’t correct it either, I think all my reviews should begin with tributes to Nic Cage:

Just got a breaking news alert from @Newsweek that Harry and William spoke at Prince Philip’s funeral, and guys, we *really* gotta talk about your definition of breaking news.

I've been on a tweetbinge the last coupla days. Time to go cold turkey for a bit. Big thanks to everyone who checked out the #lockeandkey #SandmanUniverse crossover today and shared a kind word. I'm glad folks are liking it. Be well, everyone, and happy reading.
